intro: Leptospermum scoparium f. angustifolium, commonly known as narrow-leaved tea tree, is a variant of the manuka plant native to New Zealand. It is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are typically a dark green color. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and birds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and inland areas of New Zealand. This form is notable for its aromatic foliage and has been used traditionally by Māori for various purposes.
